entity.dynamic

Class EnemyFactoryConcrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • entity.dynamic.EnemyFactoryConcrete
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnemyFactory

    public class EnemyFactoryConcrete
extends java.lang.Object
implements EnemyFactory
    This is the concrete factory method we use to generate the enemy types. The three subclasses below define the behaviour and the main characteristics of said enemies.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface entity.dynamic.EnemyFactory

        EnemyFactory.EnemyType

      DynamicSprite createEnemy(EnemyFactory.EnemyType type, TileMap tm, int row, int col)
      This method creates a certain enemy class depending on the wanted type
      static EnemyFactory getInstace()
      This method gets a new enemyfactoryconcrete instance if it's null, otherwise it returns the currently existing one.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstace

        public static EnemyFactory getInstace()
        This method gets a new enemyfactoryconcrete instance if it's null, otherwise it returns the currently existing one.

        the new/old instance.

      • createEnemy

        public DynamicSprite createEnemy(EnemyFactory.EnemyType type,
                                 TileMap tm,
                                 int row,
                                 int col)
                          throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        This method creates a certain enemy class depending on the wanted type
        Specified by:
        createEnemy in interface EnemyFactory
        Parameters:
        type - indicates if an enemy is a pirate, an octpus or a shark
        tm - is the tilemap on where the enemy will be generated
        row - is the row on which to place the enemy
        col - is the column on which to place the enemy
        Returns:
        returns one of the three enemy types
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException
